channel.title: Noob Question!

item.title: Noob Question!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

But “fatigue” is referenced in the Fatigue class, not just the client class. Also, it shouldn’t be static if you want each person to have their own level.

Read full topic

item.title: Noob Question!
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:2, topic:470707”]You can make your variables be public just like classes.

Simply put “public” before the variable and it should work.[/quote]

[quote=“mista pnut, post:1, topic:470707”]in my client class I’ve got this int defined. (I’ve tried making it static aswell)
public int fatigue;[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Noob Question!
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

You can make your variables be public just like classes.

Simply put “public” before the variable and it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Noob Question!
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

Alright, for as long as I’ve been doing this you’d think I’d know something so pathetically stupid as this.

What I’m doing is adding fatigue to my server, hence, I need the fatigue to save to each character’s character file. I’ve completed that, created the class and methods necessary, etc…

BUT, what I cannot do is figure out how in the hell I need to define this int.

If I define it in the client class and I cannot call it from my fatigue class. (Yes, I’ve imported)

I’ll show you what I mean.

Example of my fatigue class and a method:

[code=java]
package org.utopia.rs2.content.model.players;

import org.utopia.rs2.Client;

public class Fatigue {
public void restoreFatigue(int amount){
if(amount == 100){
fatigue = 100;
c.sM(“You feel fully rested!”);
} else {
fatigue += amount;
c.sM(“You instantly feel rested and now have “+fatigue+” fatigue.”);
}
}
}[/code]

and in my client class I’ve got this int defined. (I’ve tried making it static aswell)
public int fatigue;

I think I’ve explained this well enough, but if not this is the compiler for ya.

  symbol:   variable fatigue
  location: class Fatigue
.\src\org\utopia\rs2\content\model\players\Fatigue.java:28: error: cannot find s
ymbol
                        fatigue = 100;
                        ^
  symbol:   variable fatigue
  location: class Fatigue
.\src\org\utopia\rs2\content\model\players\Fatigue.java:31: error: cannot find s
ymbol
                        fatigue += amount;
                        ^
2 errors
Finished Compiling.
Press any key to continue . . .

I know this is kind of pathetic, but hey. Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
